main event: A white, disc-shaped object larger than a basketball was observed over Sparrevohn, Alaska on February 14, 1960.
interesting points: The object looked like a light beam and had no sound or trails.
The object was observed for only 2-1/2 seconds.
The report indicates the object was probably a meteor or satellite.
This sighting was similar to earlier reported sightings in the same area that were tentatively classified as meteors.
The report notes that the information was obtained from the radar station, as the individual who made the report did not actually see the object themselves.
sighted object: white, disc-shaped object larger than a basketball
